enigma.console.terminal
Class AnsiOutputStream

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.io.OutputStream
        |
        +--java.io.FilterOutputStream
              |
              +--enigma.console.terminal.AnsiOutputStream
public class AnsiOutputStream
extends FilterOutputStream

An OutputStream which interprets ANSI terminal escape sequences and causes them to display properly on a Console.

See Also:
Console

Constructor Detail

AnsiOutputStream

public AnsiOutputStream(Console console)
                 throws TextWindowNotAvailableException
Constructs a new AnsiOutputStream which will display its output on the given Console. The Console in question must provide TextWindow support.

Parameters:
console - the Console to which the stream's output is sent
Throws:
TextWindowNotAvailableException - if the Console does not provide TextWindow support
Method Detail

processEscape

protected int processEscape(byte[] b,
                            int index)
Processes a partial or complete escape sequence. The escape sequence may be processed piecewise, with each call to processEscape reading more of the escape sequence. Data will be read from the byte array either until the end of the escape sequence (in which case the escape is complete and inEscape will be reset to false) or until the end of the byte array, in which case the escape sequence is not complete, inEscape remains true, and the next call to processEscape will continue to read bytes of the same escape sequence.

Erroneous escape sequences (those which do not conform to the ANSI standard) are read until they are determined to be incorrect, at which point inEscape is reset to false and the invalid escape sequence is discarded.

Parameters:
b - the byte array containing the escape sequence or portion thereof
index - the offset within the byte array from which to begin reading the escape sequence

tryToProcessEscapeSequence

protected boolean tryToProcessEscapeSequence()
Attempts to process the current escape sequence. Returns true if no more characters are required (the escape sequence is complete or invalid) and false if more characters are required (the escape sequence is potentially valid, but incomplete).
